# Sane Tachyons Docs v3

The contents of this file are mostly autogenerated, and therefore
up to date.

Using `Cmd-F` or `Ctrl-F` to use your browser's find text program,
which can be used to find specific properties, values and classes.

## Example variables (defaults)

<!--AUTOGENERATED-VARIABLES-START-->

```scss
// tachyons is mobile first. build screens in mobile before building
// them for larger screens <3

$one-rem: 16px !default;

$breakpoints: (
  gt20: "not (max-width: 20rem)",  // > 320
  gt25: "not (max-width: 25rem)",  // > 400
  gt30: "not (max-width: 30rem)",  // > 480
  gt35: "not (max-width: 35rem)",  // > 560
  gt40: "not (max-width: 40rem)",  // > 640
  gt45: "not (max-width: 45rem)",  // > 720
  gt50: "not (max-width: 50rem)",  // > 800
  gt60: "not (max-width: 60rem)",  // > 960
  gt70: "not (max-width: 70rem)",  // > 1120
  gt80: "not (max-width: 80rem)",  // > 1280
  gt90: "not (max-width: 90rem)",  // > 1440
  gt100: "not (max-width: 100rem)" // > 1600
) !default;

$grid-columns: 12 !default;

$colors: (
  white: #fff,

  gray-98: #F7F9FA,
  gray-94: #E9ECF0,
  gray-88: #D7DCE0,
  gray-80: #C0C6CC,
  gray-30: #3C444D,
  gray-20: #272D33,
  gray-10: #14171A,

  black: #000,
  transparent: transparent,

  black-05: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05),
  black-10: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1),
  black-20: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2),
  black-40: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4),
  black-80: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8),

  white-05: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05),
  white-10: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1),
  white-20: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2),
  white-40: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.4),
  white-80: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8),

  primary: #8d1d90,
  primary-hover: #9d3ea0,
  primary-pressed: #69156b,
  primary-disabled: #c68ec7,

  secondary: #b7de58,
  secondary-hover: #c1e270,
  secondary-pressed: #89a641,
  secondary-disabled: #dbeeab,

  success: #3bb273,       // if this is a bg, use $white text
  success-faded: #EBF7F1, // if this is a bg, use $success or $black text
  warning: #e1bc29,       // if this is a bg, use $white text
  warning-faded: #FCF8E9, // if this is a bg, use $warning or $black text
  error: #e15554,         // if this is a bg, use $white text
  error-faded: #FCEEED,   // if this is a bg, use $error or $black text
  info: #3d70b2,          // if this is a bg, use $white text
  info-faded: #EBF0F7     // if this is a bg, use $info or $black text
) !default;

// classname: (font-size in px, abs. line-height in px)
// this gets turnt into rems
$type-scale: (
  header-1: (
    72px,
    80px
  ),
  header-2: (
    48px,
    64px
  ),
  header-3: (
    32px,
    40px
  ),
  header-4: (
    24px,
    32px
  ),
  header-5: (
    20px,
    32px
  ),
  large: (
    20px,
    32px
  ),
  normal: (
    16px,
    24px
  ),
  small: (
    14px,
    24px
  ),
  caption: (
    12px,
    16px
  )
  /* caption is for fineprint, copyrights and credits only */
) !default;

$letter-spacing-narrow: -0.1ex !default;
$letter-spacing-normal: 0 !default;
$letter-spacing-wide: 0.5ex !default;

$line-height-solid: 1 !default;
$line-height-title: 1.25 !default;
$line-height-copy: 1.5 !default;

$spacing-base: 0.25rem !default;
$spacing-levels: 7 !default;
$spacing-modifiers: (
  'a': (''),
// 'h': ('-left', '-right'),
// 'v': ('-top', '-bottom'),
  't': ('-top'),
  'r': ('-right'),
  'b': ('-bottom'),
  'l': ('-left')
) !default;

$height-base: 0.25rem !default;
$height-levels: 7 !default;

$width-base: 0.25rem !default;
$width-levels: 7 !default;

$max-width-base: 0.25rem !default;
$max-width-levels: 10 !default;

$border-radius-base: 0.0625rem !default;
$border-radius-levels: 6 !default;

$border-width-base: 0.0625rem !default;
$border-width-levels: 5 !default;
```

## The stylesheet

/* Display */
.di { display: inline; }
.db { display: block; }
.dib { display: inline-block; }
.dfx { display: flex; }
.difx { display: inline-flex; }
.dn { display: none; }

/* Tip: If you haven't declared a border color, but set border on an element, it will be set to the current text color. */
/* Text colors */
.white { color: #fff; }
.gray-98 { color: #F7F9FA; }
.gray-94 { color: #E9ECF0; }
.gray-88 { color: #D7DCE0; }

/* Base:  b = border  Modifiers:  a = all  t = top  r = right  b = bottom  l = left  n = none  */
.ba { border-style: solid; border-width: 1px; }
.bt { border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 1px; }
.br { border-right-style: solid; border-right-width: 1px; }
.bb { border-bottom-style: solid; border-bottom-width: 1px; }
.bl { border-left-style: solid; border-left-width: 1px; }
.bn { border-style: none; border-width: 0; }

/*
Border colors can be used to extend the base 
border classes ba,bt,bb,br,bl found in the _borders.css file. 

The base border class by default will set the color of the border 
to that of the current text color. These classes are for the cases 
where you desire for the text and border colors to be different.
*/
.b--white { border-color: #fff; }
.b--gray-98 { border-color: #F7F9FA; }
